results.title: Childhood, well-being and a therapeutic ethos / editors, Richard House and Del Loewenthal.
abstracts: "All is clearly not well with children's well-being in the Anglo-Saxon West, as witnessed by a steady stream of research reports that place children's well-being in the UK and the USA very near, if not at, the bottom of international tables. This mounting cultural and political concern for children's well-being has been buttressed by high-profile media interest in the "toxic childhood" theme popularized by author Sue Palmer, and highlighted in the Open Letter published by the Daily Telegraph; and the chapters in this important new book arose directly from the addresses given by prominent Open Letter signatories to an expert seminar organized by Roehampton University's Research Centre for Therapeutic Education in December 2006." "A key theme of this book is that we urgently need a therapeutic ethos in order to bring both educational and therapeutic sensibilities to bear on the issue of children's wellbeing, if truly effective and appropriate policy responses to the current malaise are to be fashioned. Not least, we must pay particular attention to childhood experience, showing that scientific and technical developments are always secondary to the resources of the human soul, if we are to minimize the extent to which today's children will need therapy as adults. This will entail moving beyond narrowly mechanistic definitions of, and ways of thinking about, "well-being" and the psychological therapies. This book offers pointers to the kinds of arguments that can inform what is rapidly becoming a central concern of politicians and policy-makers." "A unique book in the field, Childhood, Well-being and A Therapeutic Ethos will be core cross-disciplinary reading in a range of academic and training contexts, including within Education, Psychology and Sociology departments, on early childhood studies and policy studies modules and degrees, and on child and other psychotherapy and counselling trainings."--Jacket.

results.title: Child psychology & development for dummies [electronic resource] / by Laura L. Smith and Charles H. Elliott.
abstracts: An essential guide for parents, teachers, and caregivers, this text provides an informational guide to cognitive development at every stage of a child's life. It includes expert tips and guidance on how to diagnose, treat, and overcome the cognitive barriers that impede learning and development. -- Provide by publisher.

results.title: Playing to learn [electronic resource] : the role of play in the early years / Sandra Smidt.
abstracts: What do we mean when we use the word 'play' in terms of learning and development? This book argues that all play is purposeful. It clarifies what is required of practitioners and sets out to explain what play is and why it is so important as one of the key ways of learning.

results.title: Reading Winnicott [electronic resource] / edited by Lesley Caldwell and Angela Joyce.
abstracts: Reading Winnicott brings together a selection of papers by the psychoanalyst and paediatrician Donald Winnicott, providing an insight into his work and charting its impact on the well being of mothers, babies, children and families.

results.title: The purpose of boys [electronic resource] : helping our sons find meaning, significance, and direction in their lives / Michael Gurian.
abstracts: The author assembles invaluable insights and resources, especially mentoring resources that will assist in the transition of boys to men and eventually help propel them into a purpose-driven life.

results.title: Stranger in the nest : do parents really shape their child's personality, intelligence, or character? / David B. Cohen.
abstracts: For decades, millions of parents have been told that they are primarily responsible for things gone wrong with their children. Mothers and fathers have internalized this message, producing an unrealistic and damaging sense of guilt, and even betrayal. Parents do affect their children, but how much? Our children are not born as blank slates. They come to us encrypted with their own predilections, biases, strengths, and weaknesses, many of which are as beyond the control of parents as determining their child's gender or eye color. Here, for the first time, is a scientifically grounded examination of the controversial idea that nature - in the form of genetic blueprints - may have far more influence on how children develop than a particular style of parenting. Parents reeling from the idea that they don't have much impact on how their children think, feel, and behave, will find both surprise and comfort in psychologist David Cohen's account of the importance, and limits, of inborn traits.

results.title: Introducing child psychology [electronic resource] : a practical guide / Kairen Cullen.
abstracts: An INTRODUCING PRACTICAL GUIDE to how children think and grow. Child Psychology is a branch of developmental psychology, which is the scientific study of systematic psychological changes that occur in human beings over the course of their life span. Child psychologists examine how children's brains work even before they are born, through to the beginning of adulthood. They may explore questions of how well children develop language, how they respond to other children and adults, how quickly children become aware of their environment and become autonomous from their parents. In this Practical G.

results.title: Handbook of psychological and educational assessment of children [electronic resource] : personality, behavior, and context / edited by Cecil R. Reynolds and Randy W. Kamphaus.
abstracts: These essential volumes cover all aspects of child and adolescent assessment. Leading clinical scientists summarize the state of the science of assessment paradigms, instruments, and methods. With an emphasis on practical clinical considerations, chapters also delve into issues related to test development, psychometrics, and bias. Conveniently designed for reference or text use, this vast knowledge base has been synthesized into two volumes which may be purchased separately or together. This volume, PERSONALITY, BEHAVIOR, AND CONTEXT, reviews the use of projective methods, interviewing and obs.

INTELLIGENCE, APTITUDE, AND ACHIEVEMENT surveys assessment of intelligence, learning styles, and academic ac.

results.title: Twins : and what they tell us about who we are / Lawrence Wright.
abstracts: Recent studies of twins have shaken the field of psychology to its foundation, revolutionizing our understanding of our own personalities. Because identical twins separated at birth share all the same genes, yet live separate lives, they offer a unique opportunity to test theories about the roles played by nature and nurture in shaping who we are. Twins directly challenges many long-held beliefs. For instance, a series of groundbreaking studies of twins has shown that our genes play a much stronger role in shaping our identities than previously thought. Today, scientists can actually estimate what proportion of our intelligence, our personality, and our behavior is determined by inherited tendencies. Even our political orientation and our religious commitment, it turns out, are largely governed by our genes. Twins is filled with astounding stories of identical twins who have lived entirely separate lives but have an incredible amount in common: their hobbies, their mannerisms, their taste in music, food, and clothes, their experiences in marriage and divorce, their careers, their sexuality, even the names they've given their children.

results.title: Self-esteem games for children / Deborah M. Plummer ; illustrations by Jane Serrurier.
abstracts: In this practical handbook, self-esteem expert Deborah Plummer offers a wealth of familiar and easy-to-learn games carefully chosen to build and maintain self-esteem in children aged 5-11. The selection of games reflects the seven key elements of healthy self-esteem - self-knowledge, self and others, self-acceptance, self-reliance, self-expression, self-confidence and self-awareness - and includes opportunities for thinking and discussion. The book combines physically active and passive games, verbal and non-verbal games and games for pairs or groups, which makes them equally accessible for children with speech/language difficulties or those with physical disabilities. Deborah Plummer shows that the games can be easily adapted and she encourages readers to be creative in inventing their own alternative versions. This is an ideal resource for teachers, parents, carers and all those working to nurture self-esteem in children.

results.title: Twins [electronic resource] : and what they tell us about who we are / Lawrence Wright.
abstracts: Recent studies of twins have shaken the field of psychology to its foundation, revolutionizing our understanding of our own personalities. Because identical twins separated at birth share all the same genes, yet live separate lives, they offer a unique opportunity to test theories about the roles played by nature and nurture in shaping who we are. Twins directly challenges many long-held beliefs. For instance, a series of groundbreaking studies of twins has shown that our genes play a much stronger role in shaping our identities than previously thought. Today, scientists can actually estimate what proportion of our intelligence, our personality, and our behavior is determined by inherited tendencies. Even our political orientation and our religious commitment, it turns out, are largely governed by our genes. Twins is filled with astounding stories of identical twins who have lived entirely separate lives but have an incredible amount in common: their hobbies, their mannerisms, their taste in music, food, and clothes, their experiences in marriage and divorce, their careers, their sexuality, even the names they've given their children.

results.title: Helping children to cope with change, stress and anxiety [electronic resource] : a photocopiable activities book / Deborah M. Plummer ; illustrations by Alice Harper.
abstracts: This book is full of creative ideas for use with children who have difficulty in coping with change, stress and normal levels of anxiety. Supported by a comprehensive but accessible theory section, the practical exercises are a simple and fun way of helping children to learn healthy stress management strategies. Deborah Plummer offers over 100 activities and games specifically aimed at helping children to build emotional resilience. With a mixture of short, snappy activities and longer guided visualizations, these exercises are suitable for use with individuals or groups, and many are appropri.

results.title: Executive skills in children and adolescents [electronic resource] : a practical guide to assessment and intervention / Peg Dawson, Richard Guare.
abstracts: Concise and practitioner friendly, this bestselling guide has helped put executive skills on the map for school-based clinicians and educators. The book explains how these critical cognitive processes develop and why they play such a key role in children's behavior and school performance. Provided are step-by-step guidelines and many practical tools to promote executive skill development by implementing environmental modifications, individualized instruction, coaching, and whole class interventions. In a large-size format with convenient lay-flat binding, the book includes more than two dozen.

results.title: A.I.M. [electronic resource] : the powerful 10-step personal and career success program / Jim Carlisle and Alex Gill.
abstracts: "That is what the A.I.M. method is meant to do-to help people, as individuals, start on the path towards realizing their true potential. By doing this, it can help more people to care, more people to engage, more people to make a difference for themselves and every one around them"--P. 3.

results.title: Child development [electronic resource] / edited by Neil J. Salkind.
abstracts: Covers human development from conception through adolescence, summarizing the latest research on physical, cognitive, social and emotional development and behavior, including areas of law, medicine, psychiatry, and demography among others.

results.title: 犹太妈妈给孩子的3把金钥匙 : 生存力 意志力 解决问题的能力 / 沙拉·伊麦斯著.
abstracts: 犹太父母的聪明教养祕诀: 退一步, 放手不放任. 犹太父母最深奥的教养艺术, 不是冲锋在前, 一手包办, 挡住孩子展望未来的视线; 而是后退一步, 为孩子创造挺身而出、探索外界资讯的机会. 本书作者沙拉‧伊麦斯是出生上海的犹太后裔, 她曾是个为孩子无怨无悔付出的"中国妈妈", 为了让孩子接受举世闻名的犹太教育, 沙拉带着三个孩子移民以色列, 经历了一场教养大震撼, 她改变教养方式, 成就了孩子的未来, 也开启亲子间不同的可能. 3大关键能力的培养, 犹太妈妈这样教. 生存力: 有偿生活机制, 让孩子懂得"不劳无获". 华人妈妈: 孩子最重要的任务是学习, 家务等琐事会占去孩子读书的时间与专注力. 犹太妈妈: 身为家中成员, 孩子应分担家务 - 家事可以培养责任感、学习做事的方法 - 锻炼孩子的综合管理能力. 意志力: 延迟满足, 别急着让孩子吃棉花糖. 华人妈妈: 在能力范围, 应满足孩子的需求, 孩子感受爸妈的付出与爱, 才有足够安全感. 犹太妈妈: 深知"欲望无穷"的道理, 教孩子以劳力换取想要的东西 - 训练孩子在延后享受中磨练意志及对人生的期许 - 变得更有弹性, 学习更有耐心. 解决问题的能力: 撤退一步, 学会放手不放任. 华人妈妈: 智能开发要趁早! 家长要紧盯孩子的学习, 带他上补习班, 回家后陪他写作业、练才艺. 犹太妈妈: 换个思路, 父母退居二线 - 鼓励孩子挺身而出, 寻找自己的兴趣与人生目标 - 让愿景激发孩子自发学习的意愿.

results.title: Learning and the infant mind [electronic resource] / edited by Amanda Woodward and Amy Needham.
abstracts: Until recently there has been little contact between investigations of how infants learn and what infants know. The authors consider both infants' knowledge across domains, and learning, bringing to bear direct laboratory manipulations of learning and more general considerations of the relations between experience and knowledge.

results.title: 心理韧性 : 颠覆起跑点迷思, 教出有耐挫力、热情与目的感的孩子 / 陈品皓著.
abstracts: 面对连专家都无法预测的未来, 该如何养出内心强大的孩子? 不追求"赢在起跑点", 但希望"愿意一直跑" - 本土资深临床心理师陈品皓, 累积十余年咨商辅导经验, 剖析"如何在挫折中持续努力"的成长型思维学习指南! 你的宝贝害怕犯错, 不愿去尝试与挑战吗? 班上学生缺乏学习动机, 对什么事都提不起劲吗? 家里孩子因为人际自信不足, 进而影响到自我价值感吗? 面对快速变化的世界, 我们必须不断学习, 才跟得上时代的脚步. 身为家长与教育工作者, 想要孕育下一代的成长心态, 就必须从家庭教育开始建立心理起跑点, 为孩子创造能够顺应时局的优势. 你知道, 心理起跑点的优势要怎么创造与维持吗? 你知道, 有效沟通可以帮助孩子跳脱框架, 走出负向学习循环吗? 你知道, 人际关系的品质与好坏, 会影响一个人的心理韧性强度吗? 临床心理师陈品皓, 汇整多年来的儿少咨商辅导经验, 针对心理起跑点的两大核心 - 安全感与自信心, 归纳出强化心理素质的五大重点, 搭配具体而丰富的沟通情境和案例, 帮助孩子变得坚强、不畏惧困难, 并勇于接受各种挑战.

results.title: 正向聚焦 : 有效肯定的三十种变化, 点燃孩子的内在动力 / 陈志恒作.
abstracts: 一本写给不知该如何开口赞美的大人, 以及受挫孩子的教练之书, 告诉大人如何以温暖而坚定的语言表情. 激发孩子的正向成长动力. 身为家长的你, 小时候有被夸奖过吗? 成长阶段, 你是否也曾渴望大人的鼓励与肯定, 但得到的常常是指责与"做得不够好"? 不论是父母或老师, 都希望能与孩子有良好的互动, 引导他们朝正向健康的人生道路前行, 但我们往往习惯看见孩子没做到、做不好的地方, 以批评、指责、否定的态度要求改进, 结果不但无法给予孩子力量, 反而让关系紧张.

results.title: 聪明又过动 这样教就对了! : 40年经验实证, 美国学习与专注力专家教你轻松搞定ADHD孩子(1-13岁孩子适用) = Smart but scattered : the revolutionary "executive skills" approach to helping kids reach their potential / 佩格·道森, 理查·奎尔著 ; 胡玉立, 黄怡芳译.
abstracts: 我家孩子很聪明, 但就是太散漫了! 老是叫不动, 动作拖拖拉拉, 做事常分心, 动不动就爱哭, 专注力不持久、组织力太弱、坚持力不够..... 到底问题出在哪? 其实, 不是孩子不做, 是不知道该怎么做! 这些孩子资质好、潜力佳、动机够, 缺乏的只是大脑的统整力与执行力! 将父母的大脑借给孩子, 6步骤协助孩子建立好习惯、激发孩子的潜在天赋! 作者40年来的研究与咨询训练经验证明: 父母在对的时间、用对的方法, 孩子的执行能力是可以训练的! 根据儿童发展最新研究显示, 很多有能力的孩子, 都出现「执行能力不足」情形. 美国学习与专注力专家教你: 配合儿童大脑发育、生心理发展, 针对不同年龄层, 运用4阶段儿童执行能力评量表, 找出孩子的强项、弱项; 辅以循序渐进的训练和技巧, 提升孩子的11项执行能力, 搭配27个实际教养案例, 分析问题根源, 轻松解决让父母头痛20项日常生活大小事.

results.title: 1~3岁宝宝智能发育亲子游戏卡 [electronic resource] : Funny game cards of intellectual development for 0-3 years old babies. 妈妈晒.
abstracts: 1~3岁是宝宝智能发育的关键期。亲子游戏可以增强亲子之间的互动，加深亲子感情，在宽松愉快的氛围中增强孩子的动手动脑能力。 　　《1~3岁宝宝智能发育亲子游戏卡》按月龄，为1～3岁宝宝的父母设计和收集了150个简单易行的亲子游戏，根据智能发育的5个方面进行划分，可以使宝宝的大动作、精细动作、语言能力、认知能力和社会交往能力得到全方位的提高。 　　游戏是一种教育手段和学习过程。希望年轻的父母能够抽出一定的时间，陪宝宝游戏互动，伴宝宝聪明成长。.

results.title: 0～6岁婴幼儿智力开发800问 [electronic resource] : Intelligent development for 0-6 years old children. 张峰.
abstracts: 《0～6岁婴幼儿智力开发800问》遵循0～6岁宝宝身心发育规律，从宝宝的营养发育、认知能力、动作能力、语言能力、社交行为能力和生活自理能力六大方面入手，收集了父母在宝宝喂养、教育、智力开发过程中十分关心的800个问题，并给出了科学而详细的解答，为父母们培养均衡、健康、良性发展的宝宝提供了行之有效的方法。 　　《0～6岁婴幼儿智力开发800问》内容丰富、科学实用、方便查阅，是新手爸妈全面开发宝宝智力必备的工具书。.

results.title: This is me [electronic resource] : See me in a different light. Autism Network Singapore.
abstracts: Title from eBook information screen..

results.title: 听宝宝说话 : 用爱塑脑, 掌握0-6岁幼儿发展关键五力 / 周育如著.
abstracts: 大脑发育不只是单纯的器官发展, 而是与生理、认知、语言和社会情绪发展息息相关. 0~6岁是大脑发展的黄金关键期, 虽然大脑终身都有可塑性, 但再也没有一个阶段像同0~6岁这个时期一样, 可以启动并完成如此丰富与多样的神经元连结. 重视幼儿身心发展的父母, 可以好好把握这段时间, 掌握婴幼儿发展关键五力: 亲职力、好脑力、学习力、情绪力、品格力, 帮助孩子打造更稳定、更健康的大脑基础, 让孩子一生受用! 周育如曾生动比喻: 孩子的成长, 不是"小猪变大猪"的直线式发展, 而是"毛毛虫变蝴蝶"、"蝌蚪变青蛙"式的蜕变. 这段改变的历程, 不仅仅只是"量"的成长, 更是"质"的改变, 所以学前幼儿的教养或教育, 也不应该只是用"给大人的内容打折、变少"来喂养小小孩. 这位擅长以浅白语言阐述艰涩知识的学者, 在本书中, 把难懂的心理学与儿童发展专业知识, 转化为一般人容易亲近理解的语言, 让新手父母、带孙的长辈甚至保母, 不仅能"知其然", 更能"知其所以然", 轻松理解宝宝成长背后"原来如此"的发展脉络.

results.title: 创意教具说故事 [electronic resource]. 推广华文学习委员会 Committee to Promote Chinese Language Learning (CPCLL).
authors: Committee to Promote Chinese Language Learning (CPCLL), 推广华文学习委员会.
abstracts: Title from eBook information screen..

results.title: 让孩子尽情失败吧!懂得放手, 才能让孩子独立又坚强 / 水野达朗著 ; 黄薇嫔, 钟雅茜译.
abstracts: 放手让孩子练习失败, 学会跌倒后重新站起来. 时代在改变, 育儿观念需要家长与时俱进. 让孩子学会适应社会自立生存, 才是现代父母的第一使命! 父母必须比孩子先察觉未来生存的社会, 需要孩子有抗压力懂得变通去适应环境, 育儿专家水野达朗预告未来工作方式与公司存的在一直在改变, 现在看似有发展又稳定的职业, 未来不一定仍然成立, 传统父母帮忙决定的权威教育无法胜任多变的社会生存. 所以家长应该在家庭教育中训练孩子独立自主, 不怕失败愿意多方体验的勇气, 父母在培养孩子自立自强的过程中, 不以消极角度去定义眼前孩子的举动, 改以积极的意思去看待解释, 亲子关系就能正向发展, 培养出孩子的自我肯定意识, 进而成为未来遭遇人生困境时得以发挥的潜力.

results.title: 聪明的孩子是如何学习的 = Learning without tears / 赫琳·康纳著 ; 朱可静译.
abstracts: 每个孩子都拥有独一无二的大脑, 每个大脑处理讯息的方式都不相同, 从而导致每个孩子的学习风格也各不相同. 适合一个孩子的学习方式, 未必适合另一个孩子.  聪明的家长和老师, 懂得甄别不同孩子的不同学习风格, 因材施教, 帮助孩子轻松提高学习效率.  在本书当中, 享誉欧美的学习专家、「水星模型」创始人赫琳•康纳跟我们分享了孩子的12种学习风格, 剖析了每种风格的成因, 该类风格学习者的记忆方式、对新讯息的授受度、天生的长处和可能的盲点等；并告诉家长和老师, 该如何判断孩子的学习风格, 并按照适合他们的方式来创造相应的学习环境, 帮助他们按照适合自己的方式学习.

results.title: 让孩子爱上阅读：0至6岁启蒙阅读指南  reading in chinese: a guide for emergent readers (0 to 6 years old) [electronic resource]. National Library Board.
abstracts: Title from eBook information screen..

results.title: 谁都想要教出聪明的孩子 : 培养能够随机应变的学习能力 / 长谷川和香著 ; 陆蕙贻, 李惠芬译.
abstracts: 谁都想要教出聪明的孩子, 请先从当聪明爸妈开始! "聪明"不只是能力或IQ, 而是在瞬息万变的世界, 随时都能拥有"自我调整的学习能力". 无论何时何地都能妥善随机应变的孩子, 才是真正聪明的孩子! 少子化的时代, 你的一生可能只有一次机会成为父母, 而且这一次无法重来, 你准备好为人父母了吗? 本书作者收集了一百多项哈佛大学、牛津大学、东京大学等全球顶尖教育机构针对学龄前育儿方面的研究结果, 并实际与两百多名孩童相处后, 精心挑选汇整了97%的妈妈都觉得有用的育儿方法, 集结成册, 具体告诉你如何当聪明爸妈, 教出聪明孩子: 养育孩子要先从了解自己开始, 家长的性格也会遗传给孩子. 请好好重新思考一下"何谓孩子该有的样子". 一直对孩子说"你是个守时的孩子", 他们就真的会成为那样的人. 比起奖励更重要的是, 思考如何让孩子觉得做起来有趣. 食物不只养育身体, 也滋润心灵. 不要马上回答孩子问的问题, 要与他们一起思考. 平时玩得越多, 越能开发孩子的潜能. 即使学会默读, 刻意唸出声音其实更重要. 该学什么应该由家长决定, 但要下功夫让孩子觉得是"自己决定的". 随时让孩子看见父母认真学习、乐在其中的模样. .

results.title: 自主学习, 决定未来 : 从陪伴孩子到放手单飞的教养守则 / 洪兰著. Zi zhu xue xi, jue ding wei lai : cong pei ban hai zi dao fang shou dan fei de jiao yang shou ze / Hong Lan zhu.
abstracts: 为什么女孩重沟通, 男孩重尊重? 为什么提早教育, 却让孩子没了学习动力? 决定孩子未来成就的, 不是在学校考多少分、考第几名, 而是不论到哪, 都能自动自发学习的关键能力! 为人父母者, 都期待孩子积极学习、成龙成鳯, 但孩子是不能催熟的, 尤其从大脑实验上就可以看出, 每个孩子的天生资质、学习进展都不同, 与其卖力推著孩子前进, 不如了解他们的天赋所在, 顺着天性扶持成长. 在这个世纪, 有好奇心、执行力和毅力才是符合新时代要求"聪明"的人, 过分强调智育"背多分"是十九世纪过时的唸书方法. 要背的东西交给电脑去记, 把孩子大脑的资源释放出来, 重新组织整理. 父母应该在乎的不是孩子在学校考多少分、考第几名, 而是能不能把一件困难的事做好, 让每个孩子都能自动自发学着解决问题, 为自己的学习成就负责. 我们要相信, 孩子天生是爱学习的, 不必强迫他们非要怎么做不可. 父母师长适时的陪伴, 适度的引导, 最后舍得放手让孩子去飞, 尊重、信任, 并给孩子自主空间选择与思考, 才会有超乎期待的下一代.

results.title: 教养不必恼, 自然就好 : 只求全心陪伴, 不必当完美父母 / 洪兰著. Jiao yang bu bi nao, zi ran jiu hao : zhi qiu quan xin pei ban, bu bi dang wan mei fu mu / Hong Lan zhu.
abstracts: 49个教养与成长的关键问题, 洪兰老师提出生理、情绪、阅读、品格与亲子关系等五大核心, 回应父母的困惑与焦虑, 揭开大脑发育的祕密, 教你聪明养小孩! 怀孕听古典音乐真的对胎教比较好吗? 父母的陪伴有助孩子的大脑发育吗? 孩子几岁之后比较适合出国旅行? 从小教孩子背古诗古文, 对学习有益处吗? 现在孩子好难教, 该如何教导他们诚实呢? 如何让孩子主动学习?.

results.title: 罗宝鸿的安定教养学 / 罗宝鸿作. Luo Baohong de an ding jiao yang xue / Luo Baohong zuo.
abstracts: 用爱蒙特梭利, 正向陪伴, 以同理与觉察安定孩子与自己的内在. 从理论到方法, 从孩子内在发展、有效沟通到情绪自由, 宝鸿老师教你如何教养孩子不NG, 亲子关系大提升! 宝鸿老师身为蒙特梭利专家、同时也是一个小男孩的爸爸, 除了坚实的理论基础外, 透过粉专经营, 累积大量与爸爸妈妈线上讨论教养疑问的经验, 同时也在日常教学中, 阅"孩"无数, 是爸妈在教养路上, 最信赖又温暖的好伙伴. 不论你的孩子是学龄前或是小学生, 各种教养困扰, 都能在这本书找到解方.

results.title: Mindful teaching and teaching mindfulness [electronic resource] : A guide for anyone who teaches anything. Deborah Schoeberlein David.
abstracts: Author Deborah Schoeberlein pioneers the practical application of mindfulness in education. By showing teachers how to tune into what's happening, inside and around them, she offers fresh, straightforward approaches to training attention and generating caring both in and outside of the classroom.  Mindful Teaching and Teaching Mindfulness  emphasizes how the teacher's personal familiarity with mindfulness plants the seed for an education infused with attention, awareness, kindness, empathy, compassion, and gratitude. The book follows a teacher from morning to night on a typical school day, at home, during the commute, and before, during, and after class. This book is perfect for teachers of all kinds: schoolteachers, religious educators, coaches, parents-anyone who teaches anything.

results.title: 0～2岁越玩越聪明的100个亲子游戏 [electronic resource]. （英）西门·凯玮.
abstracts: 0～2岁是宝宝体能和智能发育的重要阶段，宝宝会很快接受他所接触的各种新鲜知识。这期间，如果你定期和宝宝一起游戏，宝宝的方面能力都会得到快速发展。这些不需要精心准备、只需要花费几分钟时间就能做完的小游戏却可以让宝宝越玩越聪明！.

results.title: Adolescent psychological development : rationality, morality, and identity / David Moshman.
abstracts: "This advanced textbook presents a constructivist approach to the development of rationality, morality, and identity in adolescence and early adulthood. It provides a review of post-Piagetian approaches to adolescent cognition, examining classic theories and current research in these three domains. In addition, it highlights the capacity of constructivist theorizing to address issues of human diversity and the implications of a constructivist perspective for secondary education. Accessible even to students with no background in psychology, Adolescent Psychological Development will also be of interest to scholars who study the development of rationality, morality, and identity, especially those concerned with the interrelations among these domains and with the nature of psychological development beyond childhood."--Jacket.

results.title: The happy mom : find joy in motherhood while helping your children thrive
abstracts: In this book for mothers the author teaches mother on enjoying motherhood while helping their children thrive. In each chapter she provides a reflection based on real-life stories and examples; a set of  practical steps to help mothers think, act and be different; and a summary of the chapter.

results.title: Little angels... with horns!
abstracts: This book aims to share some of the skills for effective parenting in the face of the challenges of raising ourchildren right. This e-butterfly provides the right ingredients to help us foster a close bond with our children, which ultimately translates into a healthy, secure relationship with them in their adulthood.

results.title: The seven common sins of parenting an only child [electronic resource] : a guide for parents, kids, and families / Carolyn White ; foreword by Kirsten Smith.
abstracts: As the parent of an only child, are you frustrated because you find yourself overindulging and overcompensating? Do you treat your child like an adult, overpraise, or overprotect him? Have you expected perfection from your child yet failed to make rules and implement them consistently? If you are not a perfect parent of an only child, you are not alone. Based on the real-life experiences of Carolyn White--editor of Only Child, parent, and educator--and hundreds of interviews with only children and parents of only children, The Seven Common Sins of Parenting an Only Child celebrates the special.

results.title: The 7 worst things parents do / John C. Friel, Linda D. Friel.
abstracts: The authors elaborate on these seven behaviors: baby your child; put your marriage last; push your child into too many activities; ignore your emotional or spiritual life; be your child's best friend; fail to give your child structure; expect your child to fulfill your dreams.

results.title: Childhood sexual abuse : a reference handbook / Karen L. Kinnear.
abstracts: A comprehensive overview of recent research into the causes, prevalence, and prevention of childhood sexual abuse.

results.title: Race in the making : cognition, culture, and the child's construction of human kinds / Lawrence A. Hirschfeld.
abstracts: In Race in the Making Lawrence Hirschfeld provides a new understanding of how people conceptualize social categories and shows why this knowledge is so readily recruited to create and maintain systems of unequal power. Hirschfeld argues that knowledge of race is not derived from observations of physical difference, nor does it develop in the same way as knowledge of other social categories. Instead, his central claim is that racial thinking is the product of a special-purpose cognitive competence for understanding and representing human kinds. By demonstrating that a common set of abstract principles underlies all systems of racial thinking, whatever other historical and cultural specificities may be associated with them, he challenges the conventional notion that race is purely a social construction. After surveying the literature on the development of a cultural psychology of race. Hirschfeld presents original studies that examine children's (and occasionally adults') representations of race. He sketches how a jointly cultural and psychological approach to race might proceed, showing how this approach yields new insights into the emergence and the elaboration of racial thinking.

results.title: Anti-angiogenesis drug discovery and development. Vol. 5
abstracts: This issue presents reviews on development of anti-angiogenic agents and their mechanisms of actions, covering topics such as targeted therapy for tumor vasculature, anti-angiogenic therapies for the prevention or treatment of cancers, as well as microbe-based and other novel anti-angiogenesis therapies.

results.title: The belt and road initiative : environmental impacts in Southeast Asia
abstracts: This volume looks how China’s Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) will impact the environments in Southeast Asia. Case studies of Indonesia, Myanmar, Lao PDR and Malaysia show that the Chinese government and financiers as well as the agencies and governments involved determine the success of BRI in bringing about sustainable growth and opportunities.

results.title: Happy working : a career counselling self-guide
abstracts: This self-help book contains examples, exercises and reflections that the authors incorporate into their career counselling, coaching and leadership coaching practice. It helps a person to conduct self analysis prior to seeking career counselling.

results.title: Overview of China's economy
abstracts: This ebook, published by China Knowledge Press Pte Ltd, provides an account of the economic growth of China since its reform, which was started in late 1978. This publication covers the various areas in China's economy, which include its industrial and service sectors, its foreign trade, as well as its service outsourcing.

results.title: 幸福童年的真正祕密 : 爱丽丝·米勒的悲剧 / 马丁·米勒作 ; 林砚芬译.
abstracts: "我作梦也想不到要写一本关于我母亲的书, 她对我来说是一个陌生到无法描写的人......"　身为举世闻名的儿童心理学家爱丽丝·米勒的独子, 马丁·米勒与母亲的关系却疏离而紧绷, 他甚至为此濒临崩溃. 母亲过世后, 马丁终于鼓起勇气, 藉著书写本书重新认识母亲这个人, 才终于同理双方的处境, 也明辨了爱丽丝．米勒理论的价值及侷限. 爱丽丝·米勒以《幸福童年的祕密》等经典著作建立起儿童捍卫者的声名, 但她自己却从未处理童年创伤, 内心压抑的愤怒塑造出极端、激烈的性格, 儿子马丁则成了最直接与长期的受害者. 这应验了爱丽丝．米勒自己的主张：父母的创伤会蔓延到子女身上. "母亲待我犹如敌人, 真让我觉得自己像只怪物, 而她想除掉牠......"伤痕累累的马丁透过访查回溯, 揭开母亲绝口不提的早年经历：在僵化保守的犹太家庭成长、经历残酷的纳粹屠杀；他同时看见母子间因战争创伤而扭曲的情感互动, 理解母亲为何无法按她创造的知识对待儿子. 这个历程为马丁自身的情绪找到出路, 也让同为心理治疗师的他, 亲身体会到回溯家族历史在创伤修复上的价值. "当爱丽丝‧米勒的儿子并不好......即便如此, 我的母亲仍是个伟大的童年研究者. "本书可说是马丁在母亲的立论基础上, 亲身实践了更具建设性的做法, 不仅为米勒全球的旧雨新知分享了发人省思、勇气十足的生命故事, 也为心理治疗贡献了精彩绝伦的案例.
